thread.title: Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 6 vs Mets
thread.title_full: Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 6 vs Mets

title: Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 6 vs Mets
text:
Kathy Kmonicek Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 6 vs Mets 
Washington Nationals starter Max Scherzer (31) pitches against the New York Mets in the first inning of the second baseball game of a doubleheader, Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek) Kathy Kmonicek Nationals ace Scherzer pitching no-hitter thru 6 vs Mets 
Washington Nationals starter Max Scherzer (31) pitches against the New York Mets in the first inning of the second baseball game of a doubleheader, Saturday, Oct. 3, 2015, in New York. (AP Photo/Kathy Kmonicek) Posted: Saturday, October 3, 2015 8:59 pm | Updated: 9:15 pm, Sat Oct 3, 2015. 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” Washington Nationals ace Max Scherzer is pitching a no-hitter through seven innings against the New York Mets. 
Scherzer already has thrown a no-hitter this season, in June against Pittsburgh. 
The NL East champion Mets haven't come close to a hit off Scherzer. He has struck out 12 and walked none. 
The Mets' only runner reached on a throwing error by third baseman Yunel Escobar on Kevin Plawecki's leadoff grounder in the sixth. 
Scherzer has thrown 80 pitches on a brisk, blustery night at Citi Field in the second game of a day-night doubleheader. Washington leads 2-0. 
This was the fifth time this season that Scherzer took a no-hit bid into the sixth inning. The 2013 AL Cy Young winner with Detroit is in his first year with the Nationals.
